title: Dwight K. Schrute, (Acting) Manager
description: When Jim rejects Jo's offer, Dwight becomes acting manager at the Scranton branch, but an accident could cause his tenure to be short-lived.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We could get Deangelo flowers.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, you can't get flowers for someone who's in a coma. They'll wilt before he wakes up.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: That's true.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All in favor of the baskets full of chocolates, teddy bears, and balloons? [all but Dwight raise their hands]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, wait. All in favor of the knapsack filled with canned goods, chainsaw, gasoline, and emergency radio in case he wakes up post-apocalypse? [Dwight raises his hand]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope. Baskets have it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So as it turns out, unless you're a young child or a prison inmate, you don't need anyone supervising you. People just come in and do their work on their schedule. Imagine that - people like us allowed to sell paper. Unsupervised. [Darryl, Phyllis, Stanley, and Oscar are working while Andy and Ryan play on a foosball table] And yet, somehow it works. It must be because the stakes are so high.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] Well, I really appreciate the offer, but I'm just happy the way things are. Okay. Thank you. [to Pam] That was Jo, asking me if I wanted to take over as acting manager while they find a replacement. I told her... I don't want to mess this up, right? There's a consensus, people are happy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on phone] Dwight Schrute. Yes, I would. Thank you. [hangs up] Jordan, gather my things from my desk. [Dwight walks to the manager's office, rubs the door frame, sits at the desk reverently]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What have you done?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mose... you'll never guess where I am right now.

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: Aaaaahhhhh!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Can't stay there all day.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm coming.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do I at least get to go with you in this fantasy?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You'd slow me down.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight has been acting manager for three months now. No. A week. Just feels like three months. Let's see, we all have to punch in to a time clock, which is very old, very strong, and has a slot about the size of a finger. [Jim puts a pencil into the time clock and pulls it out broken in half] We were all given new business cards big enough to set us apart from the competition, which is how I learned that our titles are all now Junior Employee. Our lunch breaks are staggered to prevent wasting time. Mine's at 10:30, and I find that the first hour of the day goes by a lot quicker than the second seven hours.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Stop stalling! Come on.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: I pledge allegiance to the flag of the United States of America, and to the republic for which it stands, one nation...

quotes.speaker: All but Oscar
quotes.text: ...under God...

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: ...indivisible, with liberty and justice for all. [Kevin finishes behind the rest of the group]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Amen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excellent. Morning announcements! There's been a problem with some people sharing copier codes. Your copier code is a distinct 21-digit number that is unique to you, and you only, okay? Don't share it. [Kevin looks exasperated] Jo Bennett, our CEO, will be here today for a high-level meeting involving Gabe and myself.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Ooh, about what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's on a need-to-know basis.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I thought I needed to know for your calendar.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [quietly] General meet-and-greet. So I expect you to be on your best behavior, which means none of you will be insubordinate, nor will you foment insurrection.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Question, if we already fomented insurrection, may we be grandfathered in?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Define foment.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You define foment.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [clears throat] Please take note of the new color-coding system.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [surprising Kelly] Aha!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God, what is wrong with you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gotcha! Why are you late?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: It's none of your business, actually. It's very medical and personal.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All right. You stop me when I reach the diseased area. [Dwight points to her legs and slowly moves his finger up, stopping at her mid-section]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: In fairness, Darryl did tell me that joke, so...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh! Darryl's funny.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I know, right?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Hey, Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Can I talk to you a second about these client memos?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sure. What's going on? [in room with Gabe]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Are you still in love with Erin?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Because I am. I need to get her back. [crying] I can't be alone anymore. Andy, do you like being alone with me right now?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, this is horrifying.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: No. I don't like being alone with me either, okay? I have to get her back. Are you still gonna date her?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We're just friends, okay?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Do you promise that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, fine, I promise. We'll never date again. Can we go outside now?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: No, just give me a second. I don't want anyone to know I've been crying.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [seeing the Join the Fist flyers that Jim is hanging] Hey, hey, hey, hey. What do you think you're doing? What's this? What's the Fist?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, it's just a social club. You know, like the French Revolution, or the Black Panthers, or communism. It's just a club. Guys talking, you know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You expect me to believe that you're starting a rebellion?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope. Social club. God, I hate when everybody calls us a rebellion. [Darryl enters and brandishes his fist, Jim returns the gesture]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, you know what? I would love to join The Fist.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And we would love to have you. But not today. Unfortunately, it's a bad day, what with Operation Overthrow and everything, but I have noted it.  [Dwight tears the sign down, Jim hangs two signs in its place]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [inputting numbers into the copier and holding up the line] One...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [refills his coffee near a sign that reads "Honor System:

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Pam, I have to show you this video. You're gonna love it. It's Beyonce falling with a fart mixed in. [buzzer to indicate a blocked web site]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will never be happier than I am right now. I will also never be less happy. I will be at my current maximum happiness for the rest of my life. Because I am manager of the Scranton Branch of Dunder Mifflin. Acting Manager.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [looking at empty vending machine] No food now? Someone has to do something about Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: He put some snacks in the freezer for us.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You mean the frozen mice for the piranha?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: No. The blueberry Slurpee pouch.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: He means the ice pack.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [on phone] 2:00 should probably be okay. I can either take your number or - [Gabe ends the call]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I'm sorry. This can't wait.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: He's just gonna call back.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Erin, I am in love with you. I don't believe in much, okay? I don't believe in horoscopes. I don't believe in Christmas. Uh, uh, I sure as hell don't believe in God. [Erin and Angela both look taken aback]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [quietly] What?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Or maybe there's a God. I don't know. I mean, it's just not a guy with a long white beard. [Erin looks shocked] Or it could be. I mean, it's possible that that is exactly what - what God is. But for all of the disbelief [phone rings] I believe in us. I believe in love. You have made me believe that for all of the hokum [phone continues ringing] out... there... uh, do we not have voicemail?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Dwight doesn't trust robots to give us our messages.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Well... it's just... [ringing] it messes up my rhythm.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm taking a break from dating. Gabe was a great guy with so many wonderful qualities, but it was a challenge being touched by him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, you've really embraced the whole Bond villain aesthetic.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah, Jim, Jim, Jim. The gun is a Beaumont-Adams. Jo collects them. I thought we could have some nice small talk about it. And the piranha's a rescue.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And the desk.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The desk is a replica of Uday Hussein's desk. I saw a picture in Newsweek. Listen, I'm a very busy man. Let's get right down to business.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jo is coming later today. I cannot have a subordinate trying to make me look stupid. Okay? I need you to promise me that you'll be on your best behavior.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I promise...d other people that I would be on my worst behavior. And I gave them my word, so...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't make me fire you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You can't fire me. You're acting manager. Not office manager. So you have no firing powers.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't make me pre-fire you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You wouldn't dare.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Watch this. You're pre-fired. And when I'm promoted, you'll be full fired.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [quietly] If you get promoted, and if you haven't fallen in love with me by then.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: If I had thought that there was a real chance that Dwight would be permanent manager, I would have pre-quit. And you might be saying to yourself, "Well that's pretty premature to think," but I always say, it's better to be pre-pre-preprepared.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How you doing, Jordan?

quotes.speaker: Jordan
quotes.text: I'm good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Everyone here thinks that you're a joke. They think that you were hired because of your good looks, which won't last long anyway. As your pale skin and severe bone structure imply, you'll age swiftly and poorly.

quotes.speaker: Jordan
quotes.text: Why are you telling me this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Now I want you to find out what people are saying about me, things they don't want me to know abou-[Dwight opens a box and sits down in shock] Ohh... it's a holster.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [walking around the office with the holster around his waist] Yep. Yep, yep, yep. Lookin' good. [grunts] Ohh... [stretching out his arms to better indicate the gun and holster] Oh, what a day. What a day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, are you carrying a gun?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The holster was a gift from my great-uncle Honk. Um, I don't know. I guess he's saying that he's proud of me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dwight, guns make me really uncomfortable.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The gun is just an accessory to the holster, okay? I can't walk around wearing an empty holster.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why do you need to wear the holster at all?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why do you need to keep wearing those booby shirts all the time?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You could put your cell phone in it instead.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh... hello! [indicates his phone clipped onto his belt]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You could put a banana in it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why would I put a banana in my holster?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: In case you weren't hungry now, but you got hungry later.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, no gun, okay? Don't make us call Jo.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. All right. Fine. Everyone calm down. Someone get me a banana. Sorry I freaked you guys out - aah! [Dwight goes to flip the gun and it fires near Andy's ear, making everyone jump]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Aah! Aah! It's so loud!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: My God. There is a hardwood floor underneath this carpeting. Why would they do that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [trying to find a pitch] Eeeeeeee... There's like this crazy ringing going on. I can't - eeeeeee... I can't find perfect C.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Okay, everyone make a list of what's lost for the insurance. I lost a necklace, a ring, a painting-

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, what happened?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Dwight went on a shooting spree, and then he shot Andy in the head.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no. All we know is that a gun fired. That's all we know! No. That's not true. Actually, we heard a loud noise. Later, a hole was seen. No one saw the bullet leave the gun.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [scatting off-key] Something's definitely wrong.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'll look on WebMD. What are your symptoms?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, everybody. Oscar found a reason to look on WebMD.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [buzzer to indicate a blocked site] Firewall.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I can't reach Jo. She must already be on the plane.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, why are you calling Jo?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I think I should go the hospital.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'll go with you.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: No! We really shouldn't be without a receptionist. Now more than ever.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'll take him.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you, Darryl. [Andy limps out of his chair and leans on Darryl for support]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What's wrong with you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's my ear.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay, sorry.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [excitedly] Oh, I should get the accident report binder. I've never used the gun violence forms before.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I'm gonna keep trying Jo.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, everyone! Conference room, right now!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [enters with a cowboy hat, speaking with a Western accent] Yee-haw! Whoo-hoo! [imitates gunfire] Howdy, partners! It's me, Gun-Safety Dwight! And I'm the rootin'-est- [removes hat] I can't do this. Um, look. Obviously, a gun went off under my watch, and I'm launching a full investigation.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: We all saw you do it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really? You did? What hand was I holding the gun in? What did Andy's tie look like?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Navy blue. Little red anchors.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have no way of knowing if that's true.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I am supposed to collect eyewitness accounts. Who saw Dwight do this? [all raise their hands]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, really?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Would you consider this a terrorist incident?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I felt terrorized.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh, there's a whole 'nother terrorism booklet for that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I just really, really think we should handle this internally.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Dwight, why is it on us to protect you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Because you guys are my best friends, and I mean that. Managing you for this last week has been the greatest honor of my life. And if you ruin this, I will burn this office to the ground. And I mean that figuratively. Not literally. Because you guys are so... so important... to me. I love you guys. But don't cross me. But you're the best.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey. [Erin gasps] We're back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There he is! Our hero! [Both Dwight and Erin move to hug Andy] You look fantastic. How you doing? Here, tell us your war stories.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, I burst my eardrum. Doctor said it could take weeks to heal.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did they say what caused it? Because I know you like putting Q-tips deep into your ear canal.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: How's your hearing?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Temporary deafness in one ear. It was both ears. I couldn't hear a thing Darryl was saying while we were in the waiting room.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I was talking like this. [mouths words while pointing to his ear] I don't feel good about it, but he just kept calling himself a gunshot victim and it got to me.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Dwight, I would like tomorrow off so that I can go on my American Idol audition.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: American Idol? What? No.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Okay. I guess I can just not go. Do you guys wanna hear my solo?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [singing] Why did my temporary boss go on a shooting spree?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, fine. You can go on your singing audition.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Okay, well, then I want an extra vacation day.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Pet Day! I want Pet Day back - no dogs.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Put back everything in the vending machine except the fruit.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I put everything back in the vending machine.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Put everything back in the vending machine except... the fruit.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You have to get rid of all your weapons. All of them. Including killer fish.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, is it my turn? Ooh, I'm on the spot. I don't know. Um... you know what? I think I'm good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank God.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope. When Jo's here, can you work in "Shagadelic, baby," at least three times in a conversation? Oh, and when I cough can you do jazz hands?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What's jazz hands?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [quickly shakes his hands back and forth]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [leaves the men's room with an empty fish tank after flushing the toilet]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [after entering the men's room] What the [bleep] is that? [runs out of the bathroom] Oh, my...

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Hey, all! Cornelius, Bobo, have at it. Nobody let my dogs hump each other. They don't seem to know they're brothers.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello, Jo. Welcome. Well, shall we begin?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Slow yourself down there. Just like a man. Wants to jump right into it while I still got my socks on. Jim Halpert - the only man that ever turned me down.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I don't know about that. Just wasn't for me. But let me assure you, Dwight is firing on all cylinders. Right?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Well, some pretty big shoes to fill. I was sorry to hear about Deangelo. He was a good man. Tragic. [Jim coughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [does jazz hands, Jo notices and eyes him oddly] Well, what can you do? Life.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We have to clean this up now!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: She had so much -

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Hey, guys.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Hope I'm not interrupting anything.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No! [Erin and Andy laugh]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Hey, Andy, did you tell Erin about our conversation earlier when you said you would never want to date her again?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I just thought that it was so interesting that you promised that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Did I say that earlier? Yes, I did. Because you, Gabe, were crying...

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: No, I was not.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And sobbing uncontrollably. Yes. Uh-huh. You were in hysterics. And my maternal instincts kicked in. Is it actually how I feel? Yes. Or no. That is... between me and my diary.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oscar, can you print out last year's sale statements?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight, gimme a back massage.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, Kevin, come on.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: My back is sore, Dwight. Massage it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Kevin, not now.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey, Jo!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, okay. Shh! [Dwight begins rubbing his shoulders]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, under the jacket.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're kidding me. [reaches under Kevin's jacket] Oh God, what am I touching? It's moist.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I don't feel anything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, it's so wet.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Push harder, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can't. I can't push harder!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Go a little higher. There you go. Nope, higher. Higher. [Dwight has positioned his feet on the filing cabinet behind Kevin and is kneading his back horizontally]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, how's that?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Knead it. Knead it like a pizza.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm kneading it!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Don't eat it.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Dwight! Walk me out. Let's talk soon. And stay on top of these people. You gotta admit it - it's nice to have a little power, eh? How's it feel?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jo... I accidentally fired a gun in the office today.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am telling you this because I care too much about this job to be blackmailed into doing it poorly. All I've ever wanted was to be manager here. And if you feel that you cannot promote me over this one accident, I understand. But if you think that extortion is worse -

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Shooting is worse! Are you kidding me? It's not even in the same - you shot a gun? What is wrong with you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It was a Beaumont-Adams, if that helps.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Beaumont-Adams is a girl's gun. That just makes it plain stupid.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I take full responsibility.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Who else would be responsible?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam made me put a banana in my holster.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You shot a gun off -

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. Did I make a mistake? Yes. Do I regret the decision that I made? Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Oh, stop asking yourself easy questions so you can look like a genius.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Got it.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: I love you, Dwight. But you don't fit this job.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the verge of tears] Jo, please... I will -

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: No, child. No. It's over. Now I gotta find a replacement for my replacement.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: You three are my search committee. You're in charge of finding me my next manager. All righty?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Till then, we need a new acting manager. Now, who's got the most experience in this office?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uh, well, we probably don't want to go just on seniority.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Who is it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight. What's up?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Shut up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, you do know that Jo was right to take the job away from you, right? There's no debating that. But, I will say... in your one week, every single one of the orders went out on time. And I think that is shagadelic, baby. [Dwight sees Creed claiming the desk in the manager's office]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [giving Kevin numbers for the copier] Four, one, seven, one...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Another one?

quotes.speaker: {darryl} and {angela}
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Seven, two...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Could you turn the volume down on the beeping?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Six, nine, shut up, Oscar. Eight...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Nine first.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Nine, eight, five...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Three, zero, zero. Again, zero. Four, six...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Two, one...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, I hit three. I hit three.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: God!
